snippet: Some say a deep roster and being able to execute shorter shifts can be advantages when playing a 48-game schedule in which injuries could become a factor.
abstract: Slap Shot column; frantic sprint to NHL playoffs is set to begin after four-month lockout, with players reporting in various states of readiness and little time in the downsized training camp for planning; some say deep roster and being able to execute shorter shifts can be advantages when playing 48-game schedule in which injuries could become a factor.

byline.original: By JEFF Z. KLEIN and STU HACKEL

lead_paragraph: Some say a deep roster and being able to execute shorter shifts can be advantages when playing a 48-game schedule in which injuries could become a factor.

headline.seo: N.H.L.’s Sprint of a Season Includes Pitfalls
headline.main: A Sprint That Is Littered With Pitfalls
headline.print_headline: A Sprint That Is Littered With Pitfalls
